result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant received copy of information.

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:36 PM Defendant Maria Teresa Contreras in court.  Attorney Travis S Slattery in court for Maria Teresa Contreras.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Pfeil states the appearances. 
Court questions Atty Slattery with regards to his appointment and a wage assignment. 
Court questions the defendant regarding her employment.  
Defendant states she lost that position and is working thru a temp agency starting in September. 
BY THE COURT:  Defendant is to go to the Clerk of Courts office to update the wage assignment. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT:  On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, the court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Family Safety Plan filed by the State

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold.
No abusive contact with the victim.

ADA Dodge request bond modification.
Atty Slattery has no objections.
BY THE COURT:  Bond modified since the family safety plan was filed with the district attorney's office.

1:45 PM Defendant Maria Teresa Contreras appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Travis S Slattery in court for Maria Teresa Contreras.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.
BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: /s/LJM 6-22-2022 - Approved - Judge Eagon.

2:20 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Maria Teresa Contreras in court. 

Court reviews the file and questions the defendant. 
Defendant responds.  She was denied by the public defender.  She asked for a court appointed attorney and was also denied.  Requests to speak to the DA and settle the matter today. 
Court informs the defendant that this is a felony matter and she has a right to a preliminary hearing.  
Defendant states she is currently on probation. 
Court questions the defendant. 
Defendant was denied a public defender because she has a job. 
Court questions Atty Pfeil. 
Atty Pfeil reponds. 

Court informs the defendant to obtain a Petition for Appointment of Counsel from the Clerk of Courts office, complete that and return it to the Branch 2 office for Judge Flugaur to review this afternoon on break.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
/s/LJM 6/22/2022 - Approved.

records.addlTxt: Indigency hearing on June 27, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

1:44 PM Defendant Maria Teresa Contreras appeared in court.  Attorney Brian Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

ADA Pfeil indicates that the defendant last appeared on May 16, 2022 for a bond hearing.
1:45 p.m.  Defendant now appears.

Defendant has not received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court will print a copy of the complaint for the defendant for review.
Case to be recalled.
1:52 p.m.  Case is now recalled.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Defendant waives reading of the complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
Defendant was denied for a public defender.
Defendant will be filing her petition for a court appointed attorney.
Defendant would request an adjournment.
Court questions the defendant with regards to representing herself if she is determined to not be eligible for court appointed attorney.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued. 
Defendant is capable of representing herself if she does not get an attorney appointed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 27, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

CAP Services: Personalized Family Safety Plan filed by: G.F.H. - wants contact

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold.
No contact with G.F.H. or his residence. 
May go to home one time if escorted by law enforcement to collect her belongings.

1:14 PM Defendant Maria T Contreras appeared by video, in custody from the Portage County jail.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of WI.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Maria T Contreras. 

ADA Cassidy states facts for anticipated charges of Disorderly Conduct/Domestic Abuse. 
Atty Bergner does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a $1,500 signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Bergner does not have any objections as to bond and makes statements with request for contact.
Atty Cassidy does not object. 

No victim is present.
Hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
